com.twitter.heron.examples

Class WordCountTopology

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.twitter.heron.examples.WordCountTopology

  • public final class WordCountTopology
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a topology that does simple word counts.

    In this topology, 1. the spout task generate a set of random words during initial "open" method. (~128k words, 20 chars per word) 2. During every "nextTuple" call, each spout simply picks a word at random and emits it 3. Spouts use a fields grouping for their output, and each spout could send tuples to every other bolt in the topology 4. Bolts maintain an in-memory map, which is keyed by the word emitted by the spouts, and updates the count when it receives a tuple.

      A bolt that counts the words that it receives
